Class Camera

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Camera
All Implemented Interfaces:
Location
Direct Known Subclasses:
Orto, Perspec
public abstract class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
implements Location

This is the super-class for all cameras. It holds some general methods like translating, rotating, and a generalized constructor.

              Vector3 right,

Method Detail

rot

public void rot(double x,
                double y,
                double z)
Rotates the camera around in local space. The system uses openGL standard with x being the right axel, y being the up axel, and z being the axel into the screen.

strafe

public void strafe(double x,
                   double y,
                   double z)
Moves the camera in local space. The system uses openGL standard with x being the right axel, y being the up axel, and z being the axel into the screen.

orbit

public void orbit(double x,
                  double y,
                  double z)
Orbits the camera around the currently tracked object. Initially, the camera is hooked to the dummy at the origin, which means it will rotate around the origin. The system uses openGL standard with x being the right axel, y being the up axel, and z being the axel into the screen.

roll

public void roll(double a)
Rolls the camera around current view axel.

project

public Vector3 project(double x,
                       double y,
                       double z)
A wrapper function for Vector3 project ( Vector3 p3 ).

project

public abstract Vector3 project(Vector3 p3)
Projects a point in 3-space onto the view-plane of the camera. It is up to each sub class how to do this. The value returned should be scaled relative to the values in size. The camera also has the alternative to return null which will signal the point will not be drawn. This should include points behind the camera, or other points that return coordinates on-screen but should not be drawn.
Parameters:
p3 - A point in 3-space to be projected.

collDetect

public abstract boolean collDetect(Vector3 sPoint,
                                   Vector3 oPoint,
                                   double rad)
This method queries if sPoint in view-plane coordinates corresponds to a line through oPoint in 3-space. An error smaller than rad will be tolerated. This is used for selection and querying.
Parameters:
sPoint - A point on the view-plane.
oPoint - A point in 3-space.
rad - The tolerance.
Returns:
true if the two points correspond.

o - The Location to track.

doTrack

public void doTrack()
Tell the camera to move a distance corresponding to the distance the tracked object has moved, in the same direction.

public Location getTrack()
Find what object is being tracked.

The object being tracked.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string describing the current state of the camera. Mostly for debugging.
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A short status report from the camera.
